member.summary: StartBarcodeMode request class. You can use this class to specify how the barcode mode should be started. In order to start on both lanes, specify the left and right properties and also set the Lanes property to Both.

member.summary: The job identity for which to start barcode mode

member.summary: The recipe identities for which line control server should immediately (not upon barcode read) create download data and cache that. All of them need to be also in the job, otherwise an error is issued. Alternatively you can specify to prepare the first recipe in the job or all.

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.SiplacePro.LineControl.Contracts.Data.StartBarcodeModeRequest.RecipeSpecification
member.summary: Gets or sets the recipe specification. 0: Explicit (you need to fill RecipeIdentitiesForImmediatePreparation) 1: First recipe in job (RecipeIdentitiesForImmediatePreparation content is NOT taken into account!) 2: All recipes in job (RecipeIdentitiesForImmediatePreparation content is NOT taken into account!)

member.summary: If set to true, Line Control will allow a download to conflicting stations. Conflicting means that a station with the same computer name / IP address can be contained in the current line as in some other line that is also controlled by Line Control Server.

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.SiplacePro.LineControl.Contracts.Data.DownloadMessage.Id
member.summary: The id of the message

member.summary: This class contains details about a specific optimizer message.

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.SiplacePro.LineControl.Contracts.Data.OptimizerMessage.MessageType
member.summary:
Warning, Info, Error
Value MessageType
Info Message some informational content
Warning
Message indicates some warning in the data consistency, which is not hindering the system to prepare the machine for operation but which might not be the intention of the line engineer and might require some attention.
Error
An error indicates that some data inconsistency hinders the integrity check to finish successfully or that the optimizer can not find a valid setup configuration due to some constrains which must be fulfilled which are not.

member.summary: Error numbers (defined by SIPLACE generated during optimization) that you can pair with explanations stored as strings.

member.summary: Single parameter values from the message.

member.summary: Returns a that represents this instance.

member.name: P:Asm.As.Oib.SiplacePro.LineControl.Contracts.Data.ProductionScheduleElement.nLanes
member.summary:
The conveyor in question for the production schedule (i.e., where the Recipe should be produced)
Value ScheduledConveyor Description
ConveyorLanes.Left The recipe will be downloaded on the left conveyor
ConveyorLanes.Right The recipe will be downloaded on the right conveyor
ConveyorLanes.Both
The recipe will be downloaded on both conveyors. Remember that it is possible to assign the recipe to another conveyor, than in the recipe specified.
This value should be initialized based on the value in the Recipe

member.summary:
Name of the recipe to produce
The assigned recipes line must match the assigned line in the ProductionSchedule

member.summary: Stop the station by blocking all input conveyors of the specified station. Allows to lock the conveyor. Supported with SIPLACE Pro 10.0 or higher. To un-block, use UnBlockStationInputConveyor() method. The lock is only assured by Line Control Server and not the station. Thus an operator at the station can unlock again.

member.name: M:Asm.As.Oib.SiplacePro.LineControl.Contracts.Service.ILineControl.StopLine_OID(System.Int32)
member.summary: Stop the line by blocking all input conveyors from the first station in line.
member.remarks: This method might block for a while if you pass in a non-existing OID. The default amount of time is 2 minutes. This can be configured in the service's application configuration file (SIPLACE Pro configuration section - siplaceProMsmqWait value * 5 seconds). The value is the retry count that the service retries to get the given OID.

member.name: M:Asm.As.Oib.SiplacePro.LineControl.Contracts.Service.ILineControl.BlockStationInputConveyor_OID(System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Stop the station by blocking all input conveyors of the specified station. Allows to lock the conveyor. Supported with SIPLACE Pro 10.0 or higher. To un-block, use UnBlockStationInputConveyor() method. The lock is only assured by Line Control Server and not the station. Thus an operator at the station can unlock again.
member.remarks: This method might block for a while if you pass in a non-existing OID. The default amount of time is 2 minutes. This can be configured in the service's application configuration file (SIPLACE Pro configuration section - siplaceProMsmqWait value * 5 seconds). The value is the retry count that the service retries to get the given OID.
member.param: If set to true the conveyor is locked and cannot be unlocked by a new download. If set to false, a new download unlocks the conveyor again.
String to be displayed in the Line Control GUIApplication.

member.summary: Download the Recipe from the ProductionScheduleElement with the appropriate id in the defined production schedule to the line. ProductionScheduleElement ID, if this is empty, Index will be used
The conveyor lanes. Either Right, Left or Both
Processing Options (such as Auto Width adjustment, etc.) Bit Flag
If true and there are components missing, these are automatically set up (Random setup mode)

member.summary: Download the Recipe from the ProductionScheduleElement with the appropriate id in the defined production schedule to the line. If a productionScheduleElementId is specified, then this will be used to find the ProductionScheduelElement, otherwise the nProductionScheduleElementIndex is used.
member.remarks: This method might block for a while if you pass in a non-existing OID. The default amount of time is 2 minutes. This can be configured in the service's application configuration file (SIPLACE Pro configuration section - siplaceProMsmqWait value * 5 seconds). The value is the retry count that the service retries to get the given OID.

member.summary:
Block the specified input conveyors of the specified station. The blockage of the conveyors is guaranteed by the station itself. Can only be unblocked by using UnblockStationConveyor() method.
Only supported for stations with SW version 706.1 or higher.
member.remarks: This method might block for a while if you pass in a non-existing OID. The default amount of time is 2 minutes. This can be configured in the service's application configuration file (SIPLACE Pro configuration section - siplaceProMsmqWait value * 5 seconds). The value is the retry count that the service retries to get the given OID.
member.param: The conveyor lanes. Either Right, Left or Both
The reason for stopping the operation (production).

member.name: M:Asm.As.Oib.SiplacePro.LineControl.Contracts.Service.ILineControl.GetRecipeForAutoProgramDownload(Asm.As.Oib.SiplacePro.LineControl.Contracts.Data.GetRecipeForAutoProgramDownloadRequest)
member.summary: This methods checks which recipe would be downloaded, if first station would request a placement program for a PCB (or a pair of PCBs in synchronous dual conveyor mode). This check is typically done before the PCB is moved into the first station. This method may create a new recipe in synchronous dual conveyor mode, if it can't find an existing one in the job.
member.returns: GetRecipeForAutoProgramDownloadResult containing the Recipe if found.
member.remarks: The returned recipe identity is null, if no recipe could be found or created. An ArgumentOutOfRangeException will be thrown for invalid conveyorLane values None and Both. Argument conveyorLane: - Asynchronous dual conveyor: left lane and right lane is allowed. - Synchronous dual conveyor: Only right lane is allowed, as returned recipe can only be downloaded to right lane. - Single conveyor: Only right lane is allowed.
